greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Let p be the n-th prime, then a(n) = A/p where A is the smallest number (in absolute value) such that F_{p-(p/5)} == A (mod p^2) with F_n = A000045(n) and (p/5) the Legendre symbol.
comment: a(n) = smallest A such that p is a near-Wall-Sun-Sun prime. A gives the value of F_p-(p/5) modulo p^2 and a value of 0 would indicate a Wall-Sun-Sun prime. A244801 is similar but always gives the positive A, while this sequence gives A with the smallest absolute value.
link: R. J. McIntosh and E. L. Roettger, A search for Fibonacci-Wieferich and Wolstenholme primes, Math. Comp., 76 (2007), 2087-2094.
program: (PARI) forprime(p=2, 1e2, a=fibonacci(p-kronecker(p, 5))%p^2; if(a>p^2/2, a-=p^2); a=a/p; print1(a, ", "))
(PARI) a(n)=my(p=prime(n)); centerlift(((Mod([1, 1; 1, 0], p^2))^(p-kronecker(p,5))))[1, 2]/p \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 21 2014
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, Aug 13 2014
